Ad Text:
Melbourne is Australia's fastest growing city, and public transport is vital to keeping it moving. Since 2009, Metro has proudly operated and maintained a world-class train service and delivered major transport projects that shape the future of our city. Guided by our value of Safely Always, we are one team dedicated to ensuring everyone gets home safely while helping to connect and create a better Melbourne.





ABOUT THE ROLE

Our Technology Division, known as Operational Control Management Systems (OCMS), manages a range of Information and Operational Technology systems that are crucial to delivering a passenger-focused, safe and reliable rail network.

We currently have an exciting full time permanent opportunty for a Data and Information Manager to join our team based at 700 Collins Street.

Reporting to the Progam Manager - Information Management the role will drive data governance activities across the organisation.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Creating data policies and procedures
Uplifting data governance within MTM
Managing master data management, data quality and metadata across the organisation
Consult with delivery team members to assist with solution direction

ABOUT YOU

Completion of tertiary education such as Bachelor of Computer Science or similar.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with proven ability to build relationships and influence key stakeholders.
Working in a professional IT data warehousing environment
Experience in writing data policies and standards
Strong SQL Skills
Strong experience in
Data architecture from source systems to BI systems
Data Governance
Data Quality Management
Master Data Management

WHY WORK AT METRO?

Work for a multi-award-winning rail operator with rewarding career opportunities that provide you with the support and training to take your career to the next level!
Be part of an inclusive, diverse, and supportive company made up of various backgrounds, cultures, and experiences.
Work-life balance options including flexible working arrangements, 14 weeks paid parental leave, and purchasing up to 4 weeks of additional leave per year.
All eligible Metro employees receive a free Myki Pass that allows free Public Transport in Victoria.
Access to a wide range of corporate discounts including healthcare, fitness, finance, and more.

Who is Plenti?

Plenti is a fintech lender, providing faster, fairer loans by leveraging its smart technology. Plenti is a dynamic and innovative business that is growing strongly. By continuing to deliver better customer experiences, Plenti is taking market share from incumbent players in the personal lending, renewable energy, and automotive finance markets.

We are a fast moving and ambitious business that seeks to recruit smart and capable people, who can take ownership of their role to help the business thrive. With over 250 people based in Australia, Plenti is of a size where everyone can make a difference in their role and help us realise our very big ambitions as a team, as we go about building Australia’s best lender.

Plenti is a founder led business that launched in 2014, listed on the ASX since 2020 with annual revenue of over $250 million and a loan portfolio of over $2.5 billion.

About the Role:

At Plenti, we’re on a mission to make lending faster, fairer and more accessible. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for an experienced Engineering Team Lead to lead one of our high-performing engineering teams.

This is a leadership-focused role with strong technical oversight, blending people leadership, delivery ownership and architectural guidance. You’ll work closely with Product Managers and senior engineering stakeholders to drive innovation, uplift our technology stack and ensure the successful delivery of scalable, high-quality solutions.

We’re seeking someone passionate about building high-performing teams, fostering accountability and creating a collaborative engineering culture where quality and continuous improvement are at the forefront.

Key Responsibilities:

Technical Leadership & Delivery

Partner with Product Managers to assess upcoming initiatives and shape robust technical solutions

Translate high-level requirements into clear, structured and deliverable backlogs

Collaborate with Principal Engineers, Staff Engineers and Architects to align on technical direction and standards

Provide guidance on solution design and implementation to ensure alignment with best practices and long-term scalability

Team Leadership

Lead, coach and support engineers to deliver high-quality outcomes

Set clear priorities and ensure effective planning and execution of work

Make final decisions on task allocation and delivery approach within the team

Mentor engineers to support their technical development and career growth

Foster a high-performance, accountable and inclusive team environment

Quality, Reliability & Process Improvement

Ensure technical initiatives (including tech debt and platform uplift) are appropriately prioritised

Oversee incident management, ensuring timely resolution and clear ownership

Maintain and continuously improve product quality, reliability and performance

Drive improvements in engineering processes, tooling and ways of working


About You:

Extensive experience with .NET / C#, with a strong foundation in solution design

Proven management experience, with a track record of empowering teams and improving engineering processes

Experience leading engineering teams and delivering complex technical initiatives

Strong understanding of event-driven architectures and microservices

Solid knowledge of Domain-Driven Design (DDD) principles and best practices

Proven ability to establish and uphold high coding standards across teams

A strong advocacy for test-driven development (TDD)

Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills


Why Join Plenti?

Be part of a growing fintech where engineering has genuine influence

Lead impactful initiatives that shape the future of our platform

Work in a collaborative, high-trust environment

Hybrid flexibility and a supportive team culture




What's life like at Plenti?

Working at Plenti means joining a team that is high-performing, diverse, customer-focused and collaborative. It’s a place where everyone can “make it happen” and share in the results and success. If being in a dynamic industry as part of a market-leading fintech sounds like you, then join to help us reshape Australia’s financial eco-system for the good.

In return, you will enjoy a culture of innovation and entrepreneurship to take your career further. We offer flexible working and volunteer and study leave to develop your skills. We also have monthly social events, office snacks, company Townhalls and D&I initiatives and events to help you connect with your colleagues. 

Plenti is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce.

We encourage people from different backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people with disabilities. When you apply, let us know of any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process so we can accommodate you.

Who are we?

UpGuard’s mission is to make life easier for security teams. We meticulously create robust solutions that enable our customers to identify, assess, and remediate cybersecurity risk across their attack surface, vendor ecosystem, workforce, and trust relationships. Our integrated cyber risk posture management platform combines comprehensive security ratings, instant risk assessments, templated security questionnaires, threat intelligence capabilities, and agentic AI to give organizations a holistic view of their risk surface.

Our Analytics team at UpGuard supports all of our teams to extract key insights from the data that we collect. We extract data from multiple sources and build insightful dashboards to display key metrics and support leaders to make decisions. We also build integrations between systems to seamlessly collect required data. 

Why are we hiring for this role?

We’re looking for an AI & Automation Specialist to help drive the next stage of UpGuard’s growth. In this role, you’ll bridge the gap between business strategy and technical execution, transforming complex manual workflows into scalable, AI-powered solutions that streamline operations and unlock new efficiencies across the organisation.

You’ll work closely with the Lead of AI & Automation (A3: Automation, AI & Analytics) and collaborate across teams to identify opportunities where automation and AI can deliver measurable business impact. This is a hands-on role with the chance to influence how our internal processes evolve as we scale, ensuring our technology keeps pace with our expanding operations and strategic ambitions.

What will you do?

Operational Deep-Dives & Process Design - Conduct deep-dive sessions with cross-functional teams (Finance, Sales, CS, Legal, Security) and create detailed As-Is and To-Be process maps to identify bottlenecks and logic gaps
Technical Translation & Specification- Write highly detailed Product Requirement Documents, design test cases and define success parameters
Build automations and integrate AI powered tools: Be hands-on with creating n8n workflows, automation and as required, also be able to integrate new AI-powered tools with existing business processes
Execution & Sprint Management - Maintain a healthy, prioritized backlog of tasks and ensure the team is working on high impact tasks. Monitor daily progress against project milestones and proactively flag any risks to the timeline. 
Adoption & Change Management - Create "How-To" guides for every new automation launched, drive training sessions for the teams using these new tools to ensure high adoption rates and establish a system for users to report bugs or suggest improvements post-launch 
What you'll bring?

2-4 years of experience in process analysis, automation, or a related field
Process analysis: Ability to map end-to-end workflows, identify inefficiencies, and design optimised processes
API & systems integration knowledge: Strong understanding of API and systems integration, including proficiency with APIs, webhooks, and connecting various systems
Workflow orchestration: hands-on with n8n, Airflow, Zapier, or similar automation platforms. 
AI/LLM experience: functional understanding of how LLMs work (prompting, tokens, context windows) 
Clear communicator: Experience in translating technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders and gathering business requirements
Training mindset: Experience in generating documentation, tutorials, or enabled others to use technical tools
SQL: Experience in querying databases and an understanding of data schemas
What's in it for you?

Monthly Lifestyle subsidy: Use this for financial, physical, and mental well-being 
WFH set-up allowance: To ensure you have the right environment to work in, we will help you get set up within your first 3 months at UpGuard 
$1500 USD annual Learning & Development allowance: To support your career development, all team members will be able to expense development opportunities against this allowance 
Annual leave: PTO plus two additional UpGuardian leave days to give you time to recharge your batteries.
18 weeks paid Parental Leave: Irrespective of parenting role
Personal Leave Allowance: This includes sick & carer’s leave 
Fully remote working environment: While we have physical offices in Sydney & Hobart, we do not mandate compulsory attendance
Top-spec hardware: All team members will be provided with top-spec laptops for their role 
Generative AI subsidy: UpGuard provides paid subscriptions for all team members to access generative AI tools to support their work 

#LI-SR1

UpGuard is a Certified Great Place to Work® in the US, Australia, UK and India, establishing its position as a leading global technology employer. 99% of team members agree that UpGuard is a great place to work, apply now to find out why!

As an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status.

For applications to positions in the United States, please note, at this time we can only support hiring in the following US states: CA, MD, MA, IL, OR, WA, CO, TX, FL, PA, LA, MO, or DC.  

Before starting work with us, you will need to undertake a national police history check and reference checks. Also please note that at this time, we cannot support candidates requiring visa sponsorship or relocation.

We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.
